definition: more than one can bear (idiom); at the end of one's patience/the last straw
to bear/to endure/to tolerate/to restrain oneself
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
see 可汗[ke4 han2]
to bear/to endure/to tolerate/to restrain oneself

sentences.english: Driven beyond endurance, they led the villagers to arm themselves and prepare for action.
sentences.chinese: 他們忍無可忍，領導鄉親們拿起武器準備行動。

sentences.english: The incident that finally pushed her over the edge occurred last month.
sentences.chinese: 上個月發生的一件事件終於把她逼到忍無可忍。

sentences.english: It was the last straw for her; she packed up and moved north and regained her life.
sentences.chinese: 她忍無可忍，只好整理行裝，搬到北部，重新生活。

sentences.english: These unbearable conditions would led to the French Revolution of 1848.
sentences.chinese: 讓人忍無可忍，法國在1848年終於爆發了革命。

definition: to have had enough of/to be fed up with/to have had one's fill of
to rain curses (on sb)/to let sb have it/to bawl sb out
lit. change to more severe (idiom); to become more intense (esp. of shortcoming)/to aggravate/to intensify
rampant/unbridled/arrogant/aggressive
simple home-style meal/common occurrence/nothing out of the ordinary
indignant/furious
to make trouble without reason (idiom); to be deliberately provocative
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
malicious
to move aside/to get out of the way/to back down/to concede
the cool eye of a bystander/a detached point of view
Damn it!/damned/wretched
to indulge/to connive at
fortunately/luckily
unable to move a single step (idiom)/to be in an (extremely) difficult situation
to scold/to abuse/to curse/CL:通[tong4],頓|顿[dun4]
